skillTree.localised_description: The Fly Lord and his devotees despise Tzeentch, for his obsession with schemes and trickery are the polar opposite of Nurgle's delight in slow, musty stagnation.

effects.description: Melee attack: +10 when fighting against Tzeentchian factions
Weapon strength: +15% when fighting against Tzeentchian factions

skillTree.localised_description: "Dwarfs? What are they good for? And always so bad tempered. The terrible beauty of disease is not for their sullen eyes. Why can't they just die, in agony, as other mortals? "

effects.description: Melee attack: +10 when fighting against Dwarfs
Weapon strength: +15% when fighting against Dwarfs

skillTree.localised_description: Anything fired at this vile Nurglish servant's immense girth must penetrate many folds of sweaty fat before they even have the slightest chance of piercing his flesh.
Having learned much in their long years of service, this character now turns their attention to training others.

effects.description: Character will share +15% of experience earned between all other active Lords

Experience gain: +20% for characters
	(Heroes in Lord's army)
Character will share +30% of experience earned between all other active Lords

Experience gain: +35% for characters
	(Heroes in Lord's army)
Character will share +50% of experience earned between all other active Lords

Experience gain: +50% for characters
	(Heroes in Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: "My bedfellows are pestilence, famine and war… but mainly pestilence."

effects.description:
Growth per region: +5 after winning a battle
	(all provinces)

ui_effects.localised_text: Summons a unit of Infested Nurglings
Summoned unit can self-destruct in an explosion

skillTree.localised_description: Virulent disease, preferably in tandem with the foulest stench imaginable, is the best defence the Plaguefather's beloved Nurglings could have.

effects.description:
Melee defence: +5 for Nurglings units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Ku'gath not only deals in disease, but also attracts the very best candidates to Nurgle's banner to fight and kill and be favoured in their turn.
While other Great Unclean Ones merely spread disease, the Foetid Brewmaster is ever breeding new, more virulent poxes to delight his master and destroy the foe.

effects.description:
Chance of a plague spreading: +50%
	(all armies factionwide)

skillTree.localised_description: This living (well, sort of) ammunition tumbles and capers towards its target before exploding in a shower of foul pus.
Such is the sheer size of Ku'gath's gut that he can produce more and better Nurglings than other Great Unclean Ones in the Fly Lord's service.

effects.description:
Recruitment cost: -10% for Nurglings units
	(all armies factionwide)

Passive ability: "Regeneration" for Nurglings units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: The Plagueweaver's slime trail renders opponents impotent and vulnerable to his disgusting, fatal intentions.

effects.description:
Upkeep: -5% for Great Unclean One units
	(all armies factionwide)

Passive ability: "Slime Trail" for Great Unclean One units
	(Lord's army)

Upkeep: -10% for Great Unclean One units
	(all armies factionwide)

Passive ability: "Slime Trail" for Great Unclean One units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Hand-to-hand combat is a lethal match of cut and thrust. However, it’s not all about offensive strikes; parries and other defensive moves can also win the day.
Although precision in missile combat is something that can be learned, this one was born with a high degree of natural talent.
Creatures with tough hides or some kind of natural armour are tough nuts to crack - even a powerful attack may fall foul of their thick-skin.
"The enemy's fear; their blood spilt in the mud – these are the things that sustain me."
A deadly blade is especially lethal when in the hands of this master death-maker, killer and slaughterer!
Such is their power and ferocity, a wound-maker will ravage the foe, cutting and pulverising until there is only one exit - death.
The scars on this storied warrior reveal a veteran of many battles, a being not easy to kill and one worthy of respect and fear.
The iron will and indomitable presence of this leader ensures their followers remain steadfast when facing peril.
A blade that sings in defence will not let its wielder be penetrated.

effects.description: Winds of Magic cost: -1 for "Miasma of Pestilence"
Winds of Magic cost: -2 for "Miasma of Pestilence Upgraded"
Miscast base chance: -15% for "Miasma of Pestilence Upgraded"
Winds of Magic cost: -1 for "Stream of Corruption"
Winds of Magic cost: -2 for "Stream of Corruption Upgraded"
Miscast base chance: -15% for "Stream of Corruption Upgraded"

ui_effects.localised_text: Reflects melee damage dealt to unit back at the attacker

effects.description: Overcast spell: "Curse of the Leper Upgraded"
Overcast spell: "Curse of the Leper Upgraded"

ui_effects.localised_text: Reflects melee damage dealt to unit back at the attacker

effects.description: Winds of Magic cost: -2 for "Curse of the Leper"
Winds of Magic cost: -3 for "Curse of the Leper Upgraded"
Miscast base chance: -15% for "Curse of the Leper Upgraded"
Winds of Magic cost: -2 for "Rancid Visitations"
Winds of Magic cost: -3 for "Rancid Visitations Upgraded"
Miscast base chance: -15% for "Rancid Visitations Upgraded"

Miscast base chance: -15% for "Blight Boil Upgraded"

skillTree.localised_description: By stabbing a staff or some arcane conduit into the ground, an accomplished magic-user can earth or tether the Winds and hopefully reduce a chance of miscasting.
A few magic-users have the ability to store the Winds of Magic for later use, increasing their spellcasting power when it really counts.

effects.description:
Winds of Magic power reserve: +1 per turn
	(all units in army)
Winds of Magic power reserve capacity: +5

skillTree.localised_description: There are Lords that radiate power, confidence and fear, inspiring their followers to great or terrible acts.

effects.description:
Unit experience gain per turn: +100
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Imagine a rubbery, pus-filled bag lurching towards you. Now imagine it is travelling at twice its usual speed...

effects.description:
Charge bonus: +3 for Plague Toad, Knights of Nurgle, Marauder Horsemen of Nurgle, Chaos Chariots of Nurgle and Pox Rider units
	(Lord's army)

Melee defence: +4 for Plague Toad, Knights of Nurgle, Marauder Horsemen of Nurgle, Chaos Chariots of Nurgle and Pox Rider units
	(Lord's army)

Charge bonus: +6 for Plague Toad, Knights of Nurgle, Marauder Horsemen of Nurgle, Chaos Chariots of Nurgle and Pox Rider units
	(Lord's army)

Melee defence: +6 for Plague Toad, Knights of Nurgle, Marauder Horsemen of Nurgle, Chaos Chariots of Nurgle and Pox Rider units
	(Lord's army)

Charge bonus: +9 for Plague Toad, Knights of Nurgle, Marauder Horsemen of Nurgle, Chaos Chariots of Nurgle and Pox Rider units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Sensible enemies think at least twice before attacking such a diseased specimen, for even if they win, chances are they have caught something really nasty along the way.

effects.description:
Armour: +4 for Plaguebearers of Nurgle, Spawn of Nurgle, Marauders of Nurgle, Chaos Warriors, Chosen and Forsaken of Nurgle units
	(Lord's army)

Armour: +8 for Plaguebearers of Nurgle, Spawn of Nurgle, Marauders of Nurgle, Chaos Warriors, Chosen and Forsaken of Nurgle units
	(Lord's army)

Melee defence: +4 for Plaguebearers of Nurgle, Spawn of Nurgle, Marauders of Nurgle, Chaos Warriors, Chosen and Forsaken of Nurgle units
	(Lord's army)

Armour: +12 for Plaguebearers of Nurgle, Spawn of Nurgle, Marauders of Nurgle, Chaos Warriors, Chosen and Forsaken of Nurgle units
	(Lord's army)

Melee defence: +6 for Plaguebearers of Nurgle, Spawn of Nurgle, Marauders of Nurgle, Chaos Warriors, Chosen and Forsaken of Nurgle units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Grandfather loves the smallest of his many children at least as much as his myriad other grim creations, if not more so.

effects.description:
Speed: +3% for Beast of Nurgle, Warhounds and Nurglings units
	(Lord's army)

Speed: +5% for Beast of Nurgle, Warhounds and Nurglings units
	(Lord's army)

Physical resistance: 3% for Beast of Nurgle, Warhounds and Nurglings units
	(Lord's army)

Speed: +10% for Beast of Nurgle, Warhounds and Nurglings units
	(Lord's army)

Physical resistance: 6% for Beast of Nurgle, Warhounds and Nurglings units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: The flying things are beloved of Nurgle, for they are, oft-times, the method of infection for his most potent, hideous infirmities.

effects.description:
Melee attack: +4 for Rot Flies, Plague Drones and Chaos Fury units
	(Lord's army)

Melee attack: +4 for Rot Flies, Plague Drones and Chaos Fury units
	(Lord's army)

Weapon strength: +8% for Rot Flies, Plague Drones and Chaos Fury units
	(Lord's army)

Melee attack: +6 for Rot Flies, Plague Drones and Chaos Fury units
	(Lord's army)

Weapon strength: +12% for Rot Flies, Plague Drones and Chaos Fury units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: None more foul. None more black. Yuk.

effects.description:
Melee defence: +4 for Great Unclean One, Chaos Warshrine of Nurgle and Soul Grinder of Nurgle units
	(Lord's army)

Armour: +10 for Great Unclean One, Chaos Warshrine of Nurgle and Soul Grinder of Nurgle units
	(Lord's army)

	(Lord's army)

Melee defence: +6 for Great Unclean One, Chaos Warshrine of Nurgle and Soul Grinder of Nurgle units
	(Lord's army)

ui_effects.localised_text: Will spread to enemies within the Spread Range metres of affected unit

skillTree.localised_description: Sickness so vile that it strikes as true and as hard as the perfect sword-blow.

effects.description:
Speed: +10% for Nurglings, Plaguebearers of Nurgle, Exalted Plaguebearers of Nurgle and Forsaken of Nurgle units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

Melee attack: +5 for Nurglings, Plaguebearers of Nurgle, Exalted Plaguebearers of Nurgle, Marauders of Nurgle, Chaos Warshrine and Forsaken of Nurgle units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: The corrosive ooze emanating from the most ulcerous sores is one of the most effective weapons in the Urfather's foul armoury.

effects.description:
Speed: +10% for Pox Riders of Nurgle, Plague Toads of Nurgle, Warhounds, Chaos Knights, Marauder Horsemen, Chaos Chariots and Spawn of Nurgle units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

Melee defence: +5 for Pox Riders of Nurgle, Plague Toads of Nurgle, Chaos Knights, Marauder Horsemen, Chaos Warhounds, Chaos Chariots and Spawn of Nurgle units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

Physical resistance: 10% for Pox Riders of Nurgle, Plague Toads of Nurgle, Warhounds, Chaos Knights, Marauder Horsemen, Chaos Chariots and Spawn of Nurgle units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: The air most creatures breathe provides just another avenue of attack for Nurgle and his many and varied contagions.

effects.description:
Melee attack: +5 for Chaos Furies, Rot Flies and Plague Drones of Nurgle units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

Weapon strength: +12% for Chaos Furies, Rot Flies and Plague Drones of Nurgle units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

Missile resistance: 15% for Chaos Furies, Rot Flies and Plague Drones of Nurgle units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Blade and point and spell can be turned aside very easily by the Fly Lord's most-favoured servants.

effects.description:
Melee attack: +7 for Beast of Nurgle, Chaos Warriors of Nurgle, Chosen of Nurgle, Soul Grinder and Great Unclean One units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

Spell resistance: 15% for Beast of Nurgle, Chaos Warriors of Nurgle, Chosen of Nurgle, Soul Grinder and Great Unclean One units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

Missile resistance: 15% for Beast of Nurgle, Chaos Warriors of Nurgle, Chosen of Nurgle, Soul Grinder and Great Unclean One units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

ui_effects.localised_text: Will spread to enemies within the Spread Range metres of affected unit

skillTree.localised_description: Those who know the land and its secrets will travel faster and further than the foes who don't.
"You will serve me, wretch, or you will die, there is no other option."
Those that excel as looters make sure that every coin or gold tooth is found and added to the plunder. Woe betide the warrior that misses even a single copper token!
To despoil, to corrupt and ruin, to break the mortals and take their gods from them - this is what Chaos wants.
With the servants of Chaos comes the corruption – as the landscape twists, this one speeds the transformation.
This willing servant of the Ruinous Powers has a resilience that is beyond any mortal measure.

effects.description: Casualty replenishment rate: +30% for this Lord

skillTree.localised_description: "The time to strike is now!"

effects.description: Enables lightning strike battles when reinforcements are present

skillTree.localised_description: Just as all life is born, so it must wither and die. Before that happens comes disease, in all its disgusting, filth-ridden glory.
Battles can be lost, but can the war ever really be won? The advance of Ruin can never truly be halted once and for all.

effects.description:
Attrition: -10% casualties suffered from all attrition
	(Lord's army)

Attrition: -20% casualties suffered from all attrition
	(Lord's army)

Attrition: -30% casualties suffered from all attrition
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Those corrupted by Nurgle's rot flock to his putrid banner in the hope that they will be reborn anew in Grandfather's image.
This Lord's many deeds - both on and off the battlefield - have brought them renown among their allies and made them feared by their enemies.

effects.description: Hero self-defence: +25% chance of wounding aggressors

factionEffects.localised_description: Whilst other Great Unclean Ones work to spread the plagues already extant, Ku'gath is fascinated by the breeding of new and virulent life.

effects.description: Recruitment cost: -5%% for Nurglings units and characters replenishment rate +1%% for every major settlement
Ability: "Laugh of Urfather" for Exalted Great Unclean One and Great Unclean One units

ui_effects.localised_text: Summons a unit of Infested Nurglings

items.colour_text: A more deadly strain of the plague-ridden Nurglings that burst from Ku'gath's body. These creatures are particularly scabrous, spreading a necrotic toxin to everything they touch.

effects.description:
Chance of a plague spreading: +15%
	(Lord's army)
